channel.title: Life on Letters From Iman
channel.description: Recent content in Life on Letters From Iman

item.title: My Mental Problem: Am I Too Hard to Myself?
item.description: Hey! If you ever read my story here, it means you have seen me in my lowest life. Thanks to everyone that help me a lot. Now I’m recovered slowly and getting back my pace.

item.title: CI/CD at Kurio Backend with Buddy.Works
item.description: On my first time joining Kurio Engineering team, a year ago before I wrote this story, we already used CI/CD flow in every teams (mobile team, backend team, and data science team).

item.title: About Theme
item.description: After a long time not maintaining this blog, now I think it’s time to re-maintain this. The first thing I’ve done is change the theme.

item.title: The Daily Life of a Software Engineer in Jakarta
item.description: In this article, I will share what my typical daily looks like as Software Engineer in Jakarta.

item.title: What Are Some Things I Wish I Knew When I Started Programming
item.description:
Majority and Stereotype Kills Dream

I started programming 5 years ago. So practically I’ve been coding for 5 years. Back to my first time in programming, it’s when I choose the Informatics Engineering Major in University, many people look down on it. It’s like, my major is unused and my future is already determined and will became Internet cafe guard. This happen because many of people in my place, that who going to university with Informatics Engineering Major, later became an Internet cafe owner/clerk/operator.

item.title: How Bad is My First Code in Backend Production when Working as a Software Engineer
item.description: It happen when my first year in my first company as an Software Engineer. That was my first time to write a big task for the backend side. That was creating a cron-job that will work to migrate data based on our customer data.

item.title: Programming as a Passion vs Programming as a Job
item.description: When we were still in college, we always demanded for studying hard. Having a good score in every class and also active in social community, club or something.

item.title: An Opinion-based : Advices to Junior Programmer
item.description: Being junior is a bit scary. It’s like too many things that we must know and learn. The system, the teams, the new technology, and everything. Currently, I can said, I’m a junior in my office. But time by the time, my task increased and more deep. At the beginning I just instructed to code something, then report to my team lead. Now, I’m beginning to solve a problem then report to the whole team. It means, I’ve survived in Junior life.

item.title: How can I ever be a shit as a software developer
item.description: Become software developer is not a title, but it’s a responsibilities we must faced. When it’s not good, then say no, otherwise say yes. Don’t be the sh*t programmer.

item.title: The Hardest Part of Being a Non-Native Speaker of English
item.description: Writing is one of my hobby since I was still in high school. But write an English story is merely new for me. I started writing an English article/story since a year ago.

item.title: What I Learn from Working in Small Startup as A Fresh Graduate
item.description: Hey , my name is Iman Syahputra Situmorang, a Fullstack Software Engineer in Bornevia. I just start working for 6 months. A valuable 6 months to learn what is the feel when working in a small Start Up . Well it will be a shocking news, about the closing of bornevia.com. But I will not telling anything about the reason of bornevia’s closing, I’m just telling what I learn from Bornevia when I work over there.
